type.name: section
type.title: Vesting in the State of navigation markers and of rights incidental thereto.
type.context: DEMERARA RIVER NAVIGATION MARKERS ACT under Vesting in the State of navigation markers and of rights incidental thereto. 3. As from the 9th May, 1945, there shall be vested in the State  (a) the navigation markers under this Act;  (b) the right to occupy and use the sites of the aforesaid navigation markers for the purpose of keeping such markers on such sites, and of maintaining the markers in working order;  (c) a right of way over each and every of the lands (of which the sites as aforesaid respectively form parts) described in the second column of the Schedule for the purpose of obtaining ingress, from the nearest practicable point on the Demerara River or on the public road, to the respective sites of the navigation markers as aforesaid, and for the purpose of egress from such sites to the Demerara River or the public road, as the case may be.

type.name: section
type.title: Servicing of lights.
type.context: DEMERARA RIVER NAVIGATION MARKERS ACT under Servicing of lights. 5. It shall be the duty of Sprostons Limited, to service the lights associated with the navigation markers as aforesaid, and Sprostons Limited, by its agents, servants and workmen shall from time to time have power, for such purpose, to exercise the right of way under section 3, to go to and return from the sites of the navigation markers as aforesaid.

type.name: section
type.title: Compensation.
type.context: DEMERARA RIVER NAVIGATION MARKERS ACT under Compensation. 6. Compensation shall be assessed, and paid by the Government in respect of the vesting of the rights under section 3 in the same manner and to the same extent as if such rights were compulsorily acquired by the State under section 9 of the Acquisition of Lands for Public Purposes Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Offences.
type.context: DEMERARA RIVER NAVIGATION MARKERS ACT under Offences. 7. Any person who   (a) unlawfully damages, injures, tampers with, removes or destroys a navigation marker under this Act, or any light used in connection therewith; or  (b) wilfully obstructs the exercise of a right of way under this Act.  shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine of thirteen thousand dollars.
